q: Be happy now, without reason - or you never will be at all.
h:
“Be happy now, without reason - or you never will be at all.” —
Dan Millman

q: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.
h:
“The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
h:
“Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.” —
Denis Waitley

q: To be happy we need something to solve. Happiness is therefore a form of action.
h:
“To be happy we need something to solve. Happiness is therefore a form of action.” —
Mark Manson

q: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
h:
“Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
h:
“The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Happiness is an effect of doing what you love, not an end goal to be achieved.
h:
“Happiness is an effect of doing what you love, not an end goal to be achieved.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.
h:
“Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.” —
Aristotle

q: Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.
h:
“Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: What have you done today to make someone else happy?
h:
“What have you done today to make someone else happy?” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.
h:
“Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
h:
“I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.” —
Richard Bach

q: Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.
h:
“Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
h:
“Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
h:
“Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
h:
“Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
h:
“Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
h:
“To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
h:
“Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
h:
“The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.
h:
“Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
h:
“I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.
h:
“If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.” —
Robert Greene

q: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.
h:
“Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.” —
Denis Waitley

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
h:
“If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
h:
“The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: If you want to be sad, no one in the world can make you happy. But if you make up your mind to be happy, no one and nothing on earth can take that happiness from you.
h:
“If you want to be sad, no one in the world can make you happy. But if you make up your mind to be happy, no one and nothing on earth can take that happiness from you.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
h:
“Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
h:
“Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected. ” —
George Washington

q: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
h:
“There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.” —
Epictetus

q: When at last you are come to the ocean of happiness, do not go back thirsty.
h:
“When at last you are come to the ocean of happiness, do not go back thirsty.” —
Kabir

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:
“The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
h:
“Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance
h:
“Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance” —
Honore de Balzac

q: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
h:
“If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Unhappiness enters through a door that has been left open.
h:
“Unhappiness enters through a door that has been left open.” —
Zen Proverb

q: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.
h:
“When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.
h:
“Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: You can never get enough of what you don't need to make you happy.
h:
“You can never get enough of what you don't need to make you happy.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
h:
“Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
h:
“Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
h:
“Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.” —
William James

q: Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.
h:
“Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth.
h:
“Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort
